page.title: 15 The Egg Farm
page.content: One farmer in Hollywell Row who is also a Councillor,has 16,000 laying hens that average 75% laying eggs.All eggs are sold locally from Cambridge to Thetford and Bury St.Edmunds.He has 200 acres on which he grows most of the crops listed in the {farming} section. Beekeepers use his fields of oil seed rape for producing honey and as the crop has to be sprayed several times, he warns all beekeepers in the area and they keep their bees shut up in their hives on spraying days. Sugar beet is harvested at 25 tons to the acre and this produces 2 tons of sugar,and the cereal crops can now produce four tons an acre. 3 men and 1 part time lady are employed on the farm. As a lifetime resident,the biggest changes noticed have been created by the Airfield,Greater London Council Overspill scheme and farming progress.
